website_summaries.verdict: Tracking a giant snake mutant in China and evading zombies in small-town America are part of the intricate story and creepy experience presented in R.E.6.
pros: Huge array of rotting, slithering, and violent monsters
cons: Variety means you’ll likely enjoy some stories more than others

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic couch co-op game
customer_reviews.text: Although the resident evil series has started to go away from these action-oriented episodes, we have really enjoyed RE5 and RE6 as fun cooperative games to play on the couch together or online. The characters have a little nuance in their primary weapons and melee attacks, but generally play similarly enough to keep the learning curve very minimal. Levels can be a little long, but are very fun to re-play with lots of enemies and collectible items. LOTS of content as there are 3 full story modes (maybe 8h apiece, I believe), 2 of which are re-playable with a different character. I really can't recommend the game enough.

customer_reviews.title: RE6 manages to pull off four campaigns, while effectively ...
customer_reviews.text: RE6 manages to pull off four campaigns, while effectively intertwining them. Leon's campaign is classic Resi survival horror, and a far cry from RE5's sunny locales. I found this to be the most enjoyable of the four. Chris makes a return, shooting up zombied-up gunmen and huge monsters, similar to RE5, whereas Jake's chapters are more of a mix between the latter two, with some platforming thrown in.

customer_reviews.title: Really fun game to play
customer_reviews.text: Really fun game to play. I've been a Resident Evil fan since the first game, and despite the opinions of the naysayers, I really enjoyed all of the games in the series so far. Most complaints are about the games being "different" or "turning into a shooter," but people need to understand that Capcom can't keep making the same exact game over and over if they want to actually sell anything. Of course it's different from the original, but that doesn't mean it's not a fun game!

product_meta.title: Resident Evil 6 - Xbox One
product_meta.description: Platform:Xbox One| Edition:StandardBlending action and survival horror, Resident Evil 6 delivers an epic dramatic horror experience. Resident Evil favorites Leon S. Kennedy, Chris Redfield and Ada Wong are joined by new characters, including Jake Muller, to face a new horror, the highly virulent C-virus, as the narrative moves between North America, the war-torn Eastern European state of Edonia and the Chinese city of Lanshiang.
feature_bullets: Starting with four distinct, yet interwoven story threads, for either solo or co-op play, both offline and online, not only does Resident Evil 6 deliver both different perspectives and gameplay styles
Ada Wong, Resident Evil's very own femme fatale, dives into a thrilling campaign of intrigue and infiltration, featuring unique missions, gameplay and weapons. Ada is available from the start
The most expansive Resident Evil game to date- Experience the horror through four distinct yet intertwined campaigns
Solo or co-op - Resident Evil 6 delivers both single and two player co-op gameplay either offline or online
Includes all the available DLC content from Resident Evil 6: Siege Mode, Predator Mode, Survivor Mode, Onslaught Mode, The Mercenaries maps, ResidentEvil.net costumes
